Did you mistake Mob C for a salamander?

Here is my idea for a lava loving, gemstone eating, underground dwelling lizard. They were designed as salamanders but could be anything really. Salamanders are amphibeans so it may make more sense for these to be a cold blooded lizard.

They should spawn near lava pools in the overworld, mostly in caves, lazily basking in the heat it provides. If it feels threatened it may run across the lava to escape. Their diet consists exclusively of gemstones like emerald, lapis lazuli and diamonds. If you feed them one they will follow you for a while. Feeding it a diamond will make it follow you for an hour while lapis lazuli may only be for 3 minutes. The aphrodisiac of choice for the salamander is prismarine crystals.

Salamanders can detect ores up to 4 blocks away, even through walls. Whenever the salamander is within range of lapis lazuli, emerald, diamond or even nether quartz ore they will run towards it until they get out of range of the player or they hit a wall. When that happens they will return to the player run around in a circle and then run back to the ore.

When a gem you mine falls to the floor, they may rush to grab it. If you don't get to it first they will steal one and run, possibly across lava pools, to safety. Satisfied with their gem they will stop following you. If you attack the salamander they will drop the gem, if you don't they will eat it with a big gulp.

They don't drop loot so there is no reason to kill them. They might get hit once in a while though, so feeding them gems should restore their health.

In the real world rocks that enter the stomach are called gastroliths. They are swallowed by an animal to assist with digestion of plants, shells and bones. Perhaps salamanders eat silverfish too: a difficult to digest rocky insect.

Justification:

  • Emotional players tend to avoid mining e.g. "Sheep are so cute! Skeletons are so scary..." This would help those players because it is a shortcut to mining with emotive triggers e.g. "Oh they're so cute. Good boy, you found some diamond! Is it diamond? Is it diamond? Nooooooo it's lapis, again. Hey that's my diamond! Oh I'm sorry boy, here's some lapis."
  • The underground has very passive mobs - much less with a unique use.

Also could a mob like the piglins with hoglins be added. It could be called the Buffalo Warrior. Itd be nomadic neutral mob. A biped buffalo. They could spawn throught the world similar to Pillager Patrols, in groups of 2-6 that would come and go.They will use leather armor and stone weapons to keep things balanced. Armor can be dyed and weapons upgraded by the player. They will attack all hostile mobs and if Tamed any mob that attacks player or it attacks.They can be tamed with emeralds, gold or food. Tamed Buffalo Warriors will either Follow the player, Guard a spot, or Patrol an area. The Spear could be introduced as a new weapon for their ranged attack, in some ways similar to a trident but having its uniqueness and being craftable. They could also have a structure called Campsite, where they would not always spawn in; would have campfire and beds and sometimes a chest with loot, this could spawn in plains, forests and mountains. Untamed warriors would be neutral unless attacked, they would also hunt cows and buffalos when hungry. They have the potential to be knights,guards or an army for players, as well as adding more life to the overworld.

I would make it so when a Mosquito bites you its abdomen starts to get larger. If you have a potion effect, the color of the abdomen will indicate this. Mosquitos would be able to transfer potion effects from mob to mob. I'm not certain, but using a bottle on them may give you the potion. Feeding them certain ingredients may also have them generate the potion, like living brewing stands

I like the idea of giant mosquitos in the overworld, could make them around the size of bees and could make them spawn in more biomes like the jungle, savanna and mangrove swamps as they are typically found in humid climates. The idea of repelling them with fire items also sounds really good! Don’t like the idea of them giving you nausea and making nausea arrows, would probably be best to leave those out. I think another good use for mosquitos is that they could have a chance of dropping their proboscis when you kill them, and the mosquitos proboscis could be brewed to make a new potion called the potion of life steal. When youre under the effect of this new potion you can steal 10% health from mobs as you damage them. For example, if the player deals 20 damage to a mob then they would receive 2 health back or 1 heart.

I really like the idea of using mosquitos as living brewing stands in the comments, would obviously need to nerf and tweak them for that to not make them OP and make actual brewing stands redundant.

Good points, but they are partially addressed already in the upcoming 1.13 update. If you enchant a trident with Channeling and hit a creeper with it during a thunderstorm, it will turn into a charged creeper. Now, I know that that wouldn't give the same feeling as encountering one in the wild, but admit it, it's at least as dangerous for anyone foolhardy enough to try and wrangle charged creepers like that XD
